posts.com:
Storytime, /fit/.

As usual, I'm a huge weeaboo faggot, so I'm writing a story about a 30yo KHV /fit/izen who got reincarnated into a world of magic and shit.

Chapter 1 here: https://archiveofourown.org/works/24426631/chapters/58932739

Chapter 2 here: https://archiveofourown.org/works/24426631/chapters/58939003

And here's chapter 3:

- - - - -

Chapter 3: Arena

Fayn was being hunted.

She ran through the streets of her village, fires burning all around her, screams and moans coming from shadowy corners. Closing in behind her were a group of rabid Coomans, howling and retching, clawing at the air.

“Hurrghh… A girl… Hhheerrr… Girl… Aaaaaaa! I AM GONNA… I AM GONNA…!” they gargled, their bloodshot eyes flickering madly in the light of the burning houses. They sprinted, flailing their limbs, possessed.

“No!! Stay away from me!” she yelled, turning to run into a side street. She looked around desperately for a place to hide, ducking into a shallow cellar dug into the foundation of a house. She clutched her hands against her mouth as she heard the group of raving maniacs run past her hiding spot. Holding her breath for what felt like an eternity, she confirmed that she couldn’t hear anyone outside before daring to stick her head out. Climbing out, she checked behind her before setting off in a direction heading out of the village, only to run straight into the back of a Cooman. She fell to the ground.

The Cooman turned around and stared at her. In the blink of an eye, he was on her, throbbing and grinding up against her frame.

“GET OFF ME, AAAAH!” she yelled, but the Cooman had her pinned down. He leaned down and licked her dirt-covered face.

“Haaaah, girllll… A real, human girl… AAAAHH, I AM GONNA… GONNA..!!” the Cooman spat in her face.

“NOOOO!!” Fayn cried out. The cold night didn’t answer.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55790234
Fayn awoke with a jolt, flying up from her bed. She was drenched in cold sweat, gasping for air, her heart beating its way out of her chest. Looking around, she found she was still in her chamber where she’d fallen asleep, far away from the village where she had used to live. Far away from them.

“The same nightmare again...” She held a hand to her chest, trying to calm down her heartbeat. She took a few deep breaths before getting up to get dressed. As she finished strapping herself into her leather harness, someone knocked on her door.

“Rose. You’re up.” A voice said from the outside.

Fayn tied her short-cropped hair into a ponytail with a blue ribbon hanging from a hook on the wall, grabbed an apple from the bowl of fresh fruit left on a table near the door and headed out into a torchlit hallway. Eating the apple as she walked, she went down the maze of corridors, a deep rumbling sound in the distance growing louder and louder. She turned a corner and was greeted respectfully by an entourage of people waiting for her before a large metal gate. The rumbling noise had grown into a full-on roar. She handed the apple core to one of the retainers who bowed his head before her, and stepped past the gate and out onto the ground floor of a massive amphitheater. Bonfires along the top of the walls lit up the area, massive drums beating a war-like rhythm, and the rows were packed full with spectators, all chanting to the rhythm of the beat.

“ROSE! ROSE! ROSE! ROSE!” they went, increasing in excitement as they spotted her entering the ring.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55790252

Fayn raised her arms in the air, greeting the public with a confident smile, much to the joy of the crowd. In the opposite end of the ring, a metal gate opened up, and her opponent stepped out into the ring. They both walked towards the middle until they stood face-to-face with each other. The one she was about to fight was a man at least two heads taller than her, and twice as wide. He was bald, barefoot, and apart from a pair of cloth trousers, the only thing he wore was a dark, metal-studded mask covering most of his face. Fayn gave him a look up and down his body.

“Yup,” she said casually, “you’re definitely a big guy, I’ll give you that.”

The large man laughed harshly.

“For you, little girl.” He retorted mockingly.

Fayn clicked her tongue in disappointment. She glared at the masked man with her intense blue eyes.

“Don’t call me girl,” she sneered, “Let’s get this show started.”

They both turned to face a podium raised up among the rows. The crowd and drums quieted down immediately, almost as if on cue.

A slender man dressed in long, colorful robes stood up from a decorative chair on the podium, looked over the crowd, and raised his hands in a salute. He drew his breath, and let his magically enhanced voice boom out over the arena.

“Honorable members of the public, welcome, to this evening’s final battle that we have all been waiting for. At the left gate, we have our reigning master, the Champion of Ringstad here to defend her title, The Unforgiving, Blue Rose!”

The crowd went wild again, cheering and yelling. Fayn waved and smiled at the rows in acknowledgment. A few roses fell down into the ring, thrown by dedicated fans. The announcer raised his hands to quiet down the crowd before continuing.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55790266
“And at the right gate, tonight’s challenger, the mysterious masked juggernaut, Paine! Why does he wear the mask? You tell me! Let’s hear it for the brave soul daring to challenge our champion!”

Mixed applause and cheers rang from the audience.

“Good luck, faggot!” someone yelled from the back rows.

The announcer raised his hand again.

“Fighters, take you positions!”

Fayn and Paine both jumped back, getting a ten pace distance between each other. They both assumed a fighting stance.

“Let the game...” The announcer dropped his hand, “BEGIN!”

-

Natty stared at the flat piece of silvery metal in his hand. He flipped it over to read the words “Adventurer’s Guild” engraved into it along with the emblem of the guild, and flipped it over again to look at the simple rendition of his face etched into the metal, along with basic information about him written in neat columns next to it.

“You sure this was necessary?” he asked Aniki, who had just exited the branch office of the Adventurer’s Guild that they were now both standing in front of.

“Oh, absolutely, bro!” Aniki replied with a pat on his back, “You won’t get anywhere in this world without identification papers, and the Guild is the cheapest place to get one. Besides, you’re gonna need it where we’re going next.”
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55790278
Aniki started strolling down the street while whistling an upbeat tune. Even though Aniki was a [Bard], he couldn’t play any instruments, but he was damn good at whistling. Natty scratched his head, running a hand over his newly buzzed hair, and adjusted his shirt collar. Aniki had insisted on getting him to a hairdresser and tailor first thing in the morning to get rid of his literal caveman beard and mane, and get him a fresh set of civilized clothes, ‘to bring out your rugged handsomeness, and also make it more difficult for those freaks to recognize you’ he’d said with a wink. Natty pocketed his Adventurer’s ID, and followed Aniki, who were heading towards the center of Ringstad.

Before long, they were standing in front of a massive structure several stories high. Huge pillars of white, polished stone ran along its outer walls, holding up the gigantic stone bricks used to form the core of the construction. The building curved along it’s length, and didn’t seem to have any discernible corners. Arced entryways were scattered evenly along the ground floor, and people could be seen coming and going in a steady stream from all directions. From a quick glance, it seemed to take up the space of several farm fields.

Natty marveled at the sheer scale of the place. Aniki took a few steps forward and turned around.

“Welcome,” Aniki said with a sly smile, spreading out his arms, “To the Ring.”

-

“Ringstad was originally founded by soldiers who had set up camp here at the coast, waiting for a war that never came.” Aniki explained, as they walked along the walls of the Ring. “To pass the time, they would host mock battles, especially unarmed brawls, and bet on them. Rumors spread about the place, and eventually drew in people from near and far who wished to test their strength against strong opponents. Many stayed behind, and over the centuries the city grew to what it is now. Ah, this is our entry.”
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com: very nice
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55790291
Aniki dove into one of the larger arced entryways. A sign, cut in stone above it, read ‘Gymnasium’. Natty followed him. Inside was a spacious lobby, walls cut from the same type of stone as outside. A few tables and benches were placed along the walls, and a clerical station was seated before a hallway leading further into the structure. A bored looking, frumpy, middle-aged woman was sitting at the station. Aniki strolled up to her.

“Good morning, Susan. You look as beautiful as ever!” Aniki chirped.

“Fuck off, Billy.” She droned back. Her eyes went from the parchments she was reading to Natty, and gave him a stony look. “It’s 50 ren for a single entry, 1000 ren for a month’s entry, and free entry if you’re a Ring Battler.”

“I guess a single entry?” Natty said, looking to Aniki. Aniki nodded. Natty handed over 5 bronze coins and followed Aniki further in. “You don’t pay?” He asked Aniki.

“Gold Membership, baby.” Aniki said, pulling out a brass card from his inner pocket. “I pay a year in advance. Any [Bard] worth his salt would. This place has everything I need; even if I got kicked out on the street, I could bathe and launder clothes here. Besides, when I’m not guiding tourists, I’m always here training and… Making connections.” Aniki turned his head as a well-built young man walked past them, gazing at his bottom along the way.

“I am suddenly incredibly uncomfortable.” Natty remarked.

“Don’t worry, don’t worry!” Aniki laughed, “The Gym is for everyone. Just like I am.” He winked.

From the hallway, they entered into a room. Light was streaming in from narrow windows along the ceiling. There was a few benches in the middle of the room, and the walls were lined with shelves containing numbered baskets.
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55790305
“You put your clothes in one of these,” Aniki instructed, touching a basket. “Don’t worry about anything getting stolen, the punishment for stealing in the Ring is to get your hand cut off, so no thief dare risk it.”

“Alright, great,” Natty said, “but I didn’t bring a set of training clothes.”

“Training clothes?” Aniki asked, puzzled. He was suddenly stark naked. “Only women wear clothes in the Gymnasium. Real men train in the nude.”

-

The Gymnasium consisted of a long, rectangular, open field, surrounded by pillared structural walls. In the field itself were several rings marked by posts, rope tied between them, where men were wrestling against each other in sparring matches. Stone slabs in different shapes and angles were positioned in the field as well, with racks of differently-sized half-moon shaped stones with handles carved into them located nearby, people using them in conjunction with the benches to work different muscle groups. Wooden poles of different heights with metal bars mounted on them were also prevalent, and people were practicing all types of acrobatics on them. Along the edge of the field were a running track, and several athletes were doing rounds on it.

A massive lizardman waltzed past Natty and Aniki, making the ground shake and almost knocking Natty to the floor with its tail. Aniki was standing with his hands to his sides, smiling at the whole scene. He drew a deep breath.

“Isn’t it fantastic!?” he beamed, “It’s the ultimate display of raw masculinity!”

“I don’t know, bro.” Natty said, dodging a cursing runner as he entered the field along with Aniki. “But I guess this place is as good as it gets.”

“What do you mean, ‘as good as it gets?’” Aniki said, pretending to be hurt. “This place is state-of-the-art! All the Ring Battlers train here!”
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55790316
Natty walked up to one of the stone weight racks and picked one up. It was heavy and felt coarse to the touch, but it had a good balance. He curled it a few times to get a feel for it.

“Yeah, these will work just fine.” Natty smiled. Putting the weight back on the rack, he looked up and scouted along the walls, spotting a figure near one of the drinking fountains built into the foundation. He froze on the spot, his eyes fixated. He couldn’t believe what he was seeing.

“Oh,” Aniki remarked casually, after tracing Natty’s line of sight, “It’s the Ringstad Champion.”

Drinking deeply from a clay amphora was a young, slender woman, wearing a pair of short cloth shorts and a light leather brassiere. Her flawless skin was tan, with white lines alluding to where her usual clothes would block out the sun. Her toned musculature shone in the morning sun, sweat and water dripping off her, droplets from the amphora trickling down her chest, caressing the structure of her perfect abs, before continuing down her thick thighs. She poured the remaining water from the amphora onto her short, frizzy hair, and stretched herself, curving her firm back like a cat. She shot a quick gaze over at Natty and Aniki.

Natty had to drop down on the spot and start doing push-ups, as to not embarrass himself.

“He-ey, that’s the spirit!” Aniki complimented, and went over to grab a pair of stone weights.

-

“Ahhh, that’s the stuff,” Natty sighed, sinking himself into the hot water. “I can’t believe there’s a warm bath here. I had to make do with cold stream water up in the mountains.”
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>55790333
“Nothing a few Fire Stones can’t fix,” Aniki said, stretching himself as he lowered himself into the water. They were both lounging in a large, steaming bath cut into the stone floor in one of the side rooms of the Gymnasium. Natty’s entire body relaxed, having had one of the best workouts of his life. They both meditated in silence for a few minutes, soaking in the relaxation.

“Say,” Natty started, “That woman earlier, the ‘Ringstad Champion’. Who is she?”

“She’s the reigning master of the Ring, known as ‘Blue Rose’. Undefeated for over a year. Appeared suddenly out of nowhere, and schooled everyone. People say she’s blessed by the Gods with the way she fights. No one seems to be able to force her to submission.” Aniki leaned back, sinking deeper into the water. “Why, you fancy her?” he said, jokingly.

“It’s not that,” Natty said, happy that the heat had already flushed his face, “I’m just curious. It’s rare to see a woman like her in a place like this.”

“She’s here every day. Gotta stay in tip-top shape in order to remain on the throne, after all.”

“True that.”

Silence fell over the bath again. Men came and went, all respecting the quiet sanctity of the place.

“Say,” Natty started again, “Can anyone compete in the Ring?”

“Sure,” Aniki said, “but you have to qualify if you want to actually fight in front of a crowd. Why, you plan to take on the Champion?”

“I think I might have to.” Natty said with a slight smile, before sinking his head all the way under the water.

- - - - -

And that's it for chapter 3. A bit of rassling, a bit of relaxed world-building. Thanks for reading my faggotry, I hope you enjoyed it. As usual, feedback and ideas are more than welcome.
